definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly

sentences.english: Frank began to panic as it dawned on him that they might be over.
sentences.chinese: 当弗兰克渐渐明白两人可能分手的时候，他开始发慌。

sentences.english: Have a little this several days depressed, very stuffy, so absolutely go out to take a walk.
sentences.chinese: 这几天有点郁闷，闷得发慌，所以绝对出去逛逛。

sentences.english: She didn't feel a bit nervous though it was the first time she'd spoken in public.
sentences.chinese: 她虽是第一次当众讲话，却一点都不发慌。

sentences.english: At first Jan and Kurt panicked and begged her to stay.
sentences.chinese: 起初，简和库尔特心里发慌，求她别走。

sentences.english: They starved but only could eat a piece of stale bread everyday.
sentences.chinese: 他们饿得发慌，可只能每天吃一片不新鲜的面包。

sentences.english: Time hangs heavy when you're out of work and have noting to do all day.
sentences.chinese: 如果你没有工作整天无所事事的话，你会闲得发慌的。

sentences.english: Already, at eight o’clock in the morning, we were bored with our captivity.
sentences.chinese: 才早晨八点钟，我们就已经闷得发慌了。

sentences.english: Already, at eight o'clock in the morning, we were bored with our captivity.
sentences.chinese: 才到早晨八点钟，我们就已经闷得发慌了。

definition: to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
to feel oppressed/to be depressed/to feel dejected
to have nothing to do/to have time on one's hands
